headline: A Look at Constellation Energy’s Valuation After Accelerated Nuclear Restart and Microsoft Power Deal
summary: If you’ve been trying to make sense of Constellation Energy (CEG), you’re not alone. The stock is catching new interest after the company fast-tracked its plans to restart the Crane Clean Energy Center, formerly Three Mile Island Unit 1, with the backing of a massive 20-year power deal from Microsoft. High-profile partnerships like this, combined with Constellation’s aggressive push to boost capacity and reliability across its nuclear fleet, are putting a spotlight on its unique position as...
